entry.title: [WebCodecs] Improve spec compliance for configure() handling.
entry.content:
Per spec we need to transition into the configured state before

we handle unsupported config checking. In order to make a configure

followed by flush() consistent with respect to NotSupportedError

handling, we now always post when the config isn't supported.



R=sandersd

entry.title: [PA] Fix PartitionAlloc test failures on official linux64 builder
entry.content:
builder:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/linux64



sample build failures:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/linux64/140717/



Since BRP and thread isolated mod use different pools, they

can't be enabled at the same time. So PartitionAlloc has

PA_CHECK() for it at PartitionRoot::Init(PartitionOptions).

However partition_alloc_unittests' InitializeMainTestAllocators()

enables them when pkey is supported and

ENABLED_BACKUP_REF_PTR_SUPPORT is true. So PartitionAlloc test

fails on official linux64 builder.



Bug: 1482311

entry.title: Increase error tolerance in PreserveNearIntegralBounds() again
entry.content:
If a layer has an offset from integral location < 1e-3, the

antialiased pixels on the edge of the layer is invisible, so we

can safely remove such offsets. Same for size.

entry.title: Implement experiment to not PreReadFile(chrome.dll) in non-browsers
entry.content:
Context for this change is Catan's investigation into (primarily GPU)

startup performance. We believe that this change will reduce contention

by not pulling the entirety of chrome.dll into physical memory when each

process will only use its own small subset of the DLL, with the

hypothesis that this will not slow process startup because the browser

process has already PreRead the file into memory (for earlier processes)

and the sections which are used during execution are kept in physical

memory regardless (for later processes).



Bug: 1350257

Change-Id: If9579d7f15cc8373b600515aef295b547a201580

entry.title: IndexedDB: fix IndexedDBKey fuzzer stack overflow
entry.content:
There was a stack overflow when the input caused the fuzzer to

recurse excessively when creating very deeply nested (although not

infinite) IndexedDBKeys. The fuzzer is fixed to handle this case.



This also adds a check for `kMaximumDepth` to the code under

test, which is `content::EncodeIDBKey()`. This check had already

been enforced, but only in the renderer.



The browser already enforced the max depth in

`content::DecodeIDBKey()`.



A move constructor is also added to `IndexedDBKey`, without which

there was still an OOM due to excessive copying, even after fixing

the stack overflow.



Bug: 1485116

entry.title: Implement strategies for reducing caption flickering
entry.content:
This CL implements a Wait-K approach[1] and a Greedy Text Stabilization algorithm[2] to reduce the amount of flickering when translating partial speech recognition results. These approaches are placed behind two separate feature flags and only apply to translations. The following table illustrates the flicker rate for a 30 second audio clip translating English to French:

Trial 1. Trial 2. Trial 3.

None 24 25 26

Wait-K 16 20 20

GTS 4 4 4



[1] arxiv.org/abs/2005.08595

[2] go/w2t

entry.title: [APS] Post clearance of hover state on tab strip down event
entry.content:
Currently, TabStripEventHandler#onDown() attempts to clear any

persisting tab hover state when a down event is received on the strip; a

down event is always received before a subsequent click/drag/long

press/fling etc. However, during a tab close button click, the clearance

does not take effect possibly due to tab closure animations.



This CL introduces a PostTask to reasonably delay hover state clearance

in onDown() as a best effort for the clearance to take effect after any

animations triggered due to the down event have ended. This would mean

that showing the hover card for a tab that is possibly moved to the

point of tab closure, or for a tab that is selected, as a result of a

click (that follows a down event) on the tab strip, will be deferred to

until after a subsequent hover move event is detected from the point of

the down event.



Bug: 1483487, 1451925

Change-Id: I426b6178a5052a97a738fe627f35bd6dcb2106d2

entry.title: Use TLS for map to avoid access from different threads
entry.content:
There is a potential UAF as the map for a window is always used

from the same thread, but different windows can be on different

threads. One example is the gamepad controller that has its own

thread created here:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:device/gamepad/gamepad_provider.cc;l=235



Note that even though all usage in the bug is from the same thread

this is not safe if another thread is writing to the map at the

same time.



These operations are very rare and very quick which is why this is

hard to reproduce.



Bug: 1483939

entry.title: May break before float, but still fit subsequent in-flow content.
entry.content:
It is possible for a float to be pushed to the next fragmentainer, while

still fitting subsequent in-flow content in the current fragmentainer.

Therefore, keep looking for content inside a culled inline, even if

we've found a float that belongs in a later fragmentainer.



This is similar to how a float may be pushed below the current line if

it doesn't fit beside it, while still laying out items that come after

it DOM-tree-wise, on the same line. A float may be pushed to the next

fragmentainer if it doesn't fit in the current one. But there may still

be room for plenty of in-flow lines in the current fragmentainer.



Bug: 1486411

entry.title: Android: Allow build server with siso
entry.content:
It seems that the build server can work with use_siso=true now. See

https://crrev.com/c/4795995 for context.



Also updated lint.py to remove unnecessary stack trace so that lint

errors are clearly visible.



Tested with:

$ cat out/Debug/args.gn

use_remoteexec = true

use_siso = true

target_os = "android"

android_static_analysis = "build_server"



Ran (in a separate terminal):

$ build/android/fast_local_dev_server.py



Ran:

$ autoninja -C out/Debug android_lint



Applied repro CL to test failure case:

https://crrev.com/c/4881440



Incremental build without `android_static_analysis = "build_server"`:

real 2m50.600s

user 16m0.029s

sys 3m53.885s



Incremental build with `android_static_analysis = "build_server"`:

real 1m34.338s

user 8m45.628s

sys 3m58.779s



Despite the extra local fallbacks, the build is actually much faster and

completes in about half the time with the build server.



Bug: 1202732, b/296169771

entry.title: Remove CriticalPersistedTabData code
entry.content:
Now the Tab fields have been moved back to Tab from

CriticalPersistedTabData reversing the UserData pattern and other

integration points have been removed, the remaining

CriticalPersistedTabData code can be removed. Some notes:

- testShoppingPersistedTabDataSupportedForMaintenance and

testTabDestroyedSupplier started failing with my preliminary

changes ... the issue seemed to be mocking Tab. I re-wrote

the tests to use MockTab instead and they started passing.

Also updated to test the Tab being destroyed rather than not

initialized (Tab#destroyed is not the same thing as !Tab#initialized).

- I noticed acquireSemaphore was missing in testTabDestroyedSupplier

so it lacked synchronization. I added in acquireSemaphore

- setIsTabSaveEnabled is no longer needed and was used in

more tests than necessary.

- Some tests enabled ChromeFeatureList.CRITICAL_PERSISTED_TAB_DATA

for no apparent reason. I removed the annotation.

entry.title: [omnibox] Break strings on numbers.
entry.content:
Previously, when breaking strings into words, providers broke on

whitespace and symbols.



Providers used `TailoredWordBreakIterator` a child of

`base::i18n::BreakIterator`, because the latter did not break on

underscores.



This CL makes `TailoredWordBreakIterator` also break on numbers.



Given the string: `aaa bbb*ccc_ddd555fff`



`BreakIterator` produces:

`aaa, , bbb, *, ccc_ddd555fff`



`TailoredWordBreakIterator` before this CL produced:

`aaa, , bbb, *, ccc, _, ddd555fff`



`TailoredWordBreakIterator` with this CL produces:

`aaa, , bbb, *, ccc, _, ddd, 555, fff`



This fixes cases where the input 'stable 117' would not match suggestion

text 'stable m117' which was causing HQP instability.



One downside is that for shortcuts, inputs like 'a' will expand to

'aaaa' instead of aaaa1111'. This is a minimal risk since shortcut

expands appends at least 3 chars before expanding to the next word

break.

entry.title: Restore JankTracker for a new FEED_SCROLLING scenario
entry.content:
Deleted in crrev.com/c/4390908, this restores the functionality but only

tracks four scenarios. PERIODIC_REPORTING, NEW_TAB_PAGE, and two new

scenarios FEED_SCROLLING & WEBVIEW_SCROLLING, as well as making Webview

continue to work with this tracker.



We're investigating jank while scrolling the feed and want to hook up to

FrameMetrics explicitly for this new scenario FEED_SCROLLING. Rather

than hook up all the scenarios again since we only intend to look at

FEED for now we only hook up that one plus other ones that surrounds it

(that we essentially get for free because we already plumbed everything

down to the FeedCoordinator).



Due to this feature being both Chrome and Webview rename the flag from kWebViewReportFrameMetrics to kCollectAndroidFrameTimelineMetrics.



Example trace of Chrome with JankCUJ: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1XRFWlUGzkU8kTrS4iz8kv6i3iA9zIQmw/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-s3yTIuDWJfqayIaoX_YpJg

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/6bVsKX2VpxiQFTP



Example trace of Webview shell with JankCUJ: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zLPiu5Ze5gK3aUNwLyUyuUDG0rmE-Dw6/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-SeE9p-BbU04joAhUrt5BnQ





OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Android.Jank.FrameDuration]=Replaced by

Android.FrameTimelineJank.FrameDuration.*

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Android.Jank.FrameJankStatus]=Replaced by

Android.FrameTimelineJank.FrameJankStatus.*

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Android.FrameTimelineJank.WebScroll.FrameJankStatus]=Android.FrameTimelineJank.FrameJankStatus.WebviewScrolling



Low-Coverage-Reason: jank_metric_uma_recording_unittest.cc isn't being accounted for. PlaceholderJankTracker.java is a placeholder implementation no point in testing it.

entry.title: Don't remove nodes from ResourceContext registries until they're deleted
entry.content:
Stores WeakPtr's to the nodes and removes them from the registry when

the WeakPtr is invalidated, instead of in OnBefore*NodeRemoved(). This

allows clients of the registry to look up a node that's about to be

removed from the graph even if the registry handles the notification

before the client does.



This simplifies ResourceContext lookups in CPUMeasurementMonitor.



R=anthonyvd

entry.title: IndexedDB: move some functionality from DispatcherHost to BucketContext
entry.content:
`IndexedDBDispatcherHost` currently has two major responsibilities:

1. It is the implementation of the factory mojo interface to the

renderer (`blink::mojom::IDBFactory`)

2. It wires up "external objects" (blobs, files, FSA handles) to

the appropriate mojo endpoints. The entry point for this is

`CreateAllExternalObjects`.



This CL moves (2) to `IndexedBucketContext`. There was no particular

need for this functionality to be part of the dispatcher host to

begin with and it could have been part of `IndexedDBContextImpl`.

However, since `CreateAllExternalObjects` needs to be accessible from

the bucket sequence, the correct home for it now is

`IndexedDBBucketContext`. Thus, much of this CL is moving code from

`IndexedDBDispatcherHost` to `IndexedDBBucketContext`, mostly without

modifications.



The services that enable remote connection of blobs and FSA handles,

`BlobStorageContext` and `FileSystemAccessContext`, are already

accessible as mojo interfaces. However, since the endpoints are

currently owned by the `IndexedDBContextImpl`, which will live on the

main IDB sequence, they are not directly accessible from the bucket

sequence classes that need them. Each of these gets a new `Clone()`

method which allows the main IDB sequence classes to hold onto a

connection which can spawn new connections for each

`IndexedDBBucketContext`.



Bug: 1474996



Change-Id: I68cdf3689705b7c46ad4b27efd0dfb92eabe0589

entry.title: Export help bubble custom events.
entry.content:
Build rules for components/user_education/common uses source sets.

This means that, in a component build, ash and browser each create

different custom event instances with the same name.



This trips a DCHECK in element_identifier.cc which enforces name

uniqueness for element identifiers (which includes custom events).



This CL moves custom events into a new component build target so that

both ash and browser will share the same custom event instances.

entry.title: Support source_time smaller than trigger_time in filter match
entry.content:
While contradictory, it is possible for a source to have an assigned

time of T and a trigger that is attributed to it to have a time of T-X

e.g. due to user-initiated clock changes.



As a result, the current CHECK_LE(source_time, trigger_time) can cause

crashes.



This CL removes that assumption and instead consider the trigger_time

to be equal to the source time for computing the duration.



Bug: 1486489

entry.title: Reland "snap-groups: Record snap two windows duration"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 21ab723529a531aa00d927eeebbde38792aaa6d2



Fixed broken tests in https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/38477/overview.



Original change's description:

> snap-groups: Record snap two windows duration

>

> This adds metrics that will be used by Snap Groups. We want to record

> the distribution of users snapping a first window then a second window

> on the opposite side within X minutes, where X is very low.

>

> If the first window is unsnapped or closed without a second window

> getting snapped, we will record it as very high, i.e. the max bucket.

>

> Note that this ignores partial ratios, if a user for some reason snaps

> mismatched ratios (e.g. 2/3 left and 1/2 right), it will be recorded.

>

> Test: added

> Fixed: b/299666829

entry.title: snap-groups: Init SplitViewOverviewSession before StartOverview
entry.content:
This moves SplitViewOverviewSession initialization to before

`StartOverview()`. This allows us to check

`RootWindowController::ForWindow(*)->split_view_overview_session()` for

the split view state in `overview_utils::GetGridBoundsInScreen()`.



This is needed so that we can move `StartOverview()` to

SnapGroupController without depending on `SplitViewController::state_`.



Also replaces `in_snap_group_creation_session_` with checking `RootWindowController::ForWindow(*)->split_view_overview_session()`.

entry.title: [Test Automation] CheckVariable() verb
entry.content:
This fills a hole where a local or class variable is set as a result of

some operation, and then wants to check the value.



Previously, you would have to do the following:



StepsThatSetVariables...,

CheckResult([&x](){ return x; }, value_to_match),



Now you can do:



StepsThatSetVariables...,

CheckVariable(x, value_to_match),

entry.title: [sync] Make FirstSetupComplete always return true on Ash
entry.content:
...to the extent that mutating APIs are ifdef-ed out and the underlying

preference too.



Rationale: the bit has no meaning on ChromeOS Ash and was auto-flipped

to true on Ash even before this patch. This short-lived state where

FirstSetupComplete=false was prone to bugs and abuse, as well as APIs

to set or clear this bit.



Therefore, this patch ifdef-s out code that is nonsensical in Ash, and

better reflect the platform-specific product behavior.



Change-Id: I2c56b6d3303de5c24ec12d06e4f0b3a8a75392e4

entry.title: Change SVGClipPathElement to inherit from SVGElement
entry.content:
This indirectly also end up removing a bunch of methods that are on

SVGGraphicsElement (such as getCTM, getBBox et.c.) It also removes the

SVGTests implementation.

entry.title: [ash] Avoid relying on IsInitialSyncFeatureSetupComplete for animation
entry.content:
This calling site is problematic because it blocks ongoing refactoring

efforts, due to test failures attributed to unrealistic conditions in

certain browsertests.



Introduced long ago in https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10860053,

it isn't clear why IsInitialSyncFeatureSetupComplete() needs to be

consumed, given that it has no clear semantics on Ash and becomes true

shortly after profile initialization (after the first communication

round with the Sync server (initial "handshake" to download Nigori, but

before the relevant user data is downloaded).



A more reasonable predicate seems to be IsSyncFeatureEnabled(), adopted

in this patch, which is more strict.



The rationale is that it isn't legit to determine STATUS_SYNCING purely

based on the fact that IsSyncFeatureActive() returns false. It may also

be false because it just cannot start, e.g. because of enterprise

policies or because sync has been disabled via dashboard.



Change-Id: Ie9d7cf1ce53d636985f1bf673ed03165ec8017e0

entry.title: [Autofill] Eliminate AutofillType::ServerFieldTypeToString()
entry.content:
This CL removes AutofillType::ServerFieldTypeToString(), which was

identical to FieldTypeToStringPiece() except for an additional

to-string conversion.



It also replaces some expressions `AutofillType(x).ToString()`

with `FieldTypeToStringPiece(x)`. That's identical except if `x` is `HtmlFieldType::kUnrecognized` or `HtmlFieldType::kUnspecified`.

In these cases, FieldTypeToStringPiece() returns "HTML_FIELD_TYPE_UNRECOGNIZED" or "HTML_FIELD_TYPE_UNRECOGNIZED",

respectively, while AutofillType::ToString() returns "UNKNOWN_TYPE".

The only occurrence that is neither logging nor test code is in

autofill_feedback_data.cc.

entry.title: Generate test_suites.pyl from starlark definitions.
entry.content:
This adds definitions to //infra/config/lib/targets.star that enables

defining suites in starlark that are currently defined in

test_suites.pyl. Users can use targets.legacy_basic_suite,

targets.legacy_compound_suite and targets.legacy_matrix_compound_suite

to define suites that will be used to generate test_suites.pyl. These

definitions are constrained in the same way that suites in

test_suites.pyl are: basic suites can only define tests and both types

of compound suites can only refer to basic suites. This ensures that

these legacy definitions can continue to be used by builders that are

still present in waterfalls.pyl.

entry.title: Fix PaintedScrollbarLayerImpl Fluent scrollbars opacity check.
entry.content:
Fluent overlay scrollbars depend on the ScrollbarAnimator(Thinning)

classes for its animations. These animate the opacity based on the

layer's effect tree's opacity (see

`ScrollbarAnimationController::ApplyOpacityToScrollbars`), however

PaintedScrollbarLayerImpl keeps it's own `painted_opacity_` float

variable which doesn't correspond to the node's opacity. This variable

was introduced to keep track of Mac's method of overlay transitioning,

which happens by updating the opacity on the scrollbar object.



Instead of making the scrollbar animators use a different opacity

method for the different ways of tracking opacity,

PaintedScrollbarLayerImpl now returns the correct opacity for Fluent

Overlay scrollbars.



The bug this CL is fixing can be reproduced by:

1. Enable the overlay fluent scrollbars (--enable-features=

FluentOverlayScrollbar)

2. Open a webpage that has scrollbars. The overlay scrollbar should

fade into invisibility.

3. Mouse over where the scrollbar is. It will remain invisible (this

is correct behavior)

4. Press down on your mouse. The scrollbar will be hit tested and

be shown, when it shouldn't.



Bug: 1479167

Change-Id: I6b25408a6c4b0c86593da1669fdcb1cec27bd10a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4888744

Reviewed-by: Xianzhu Wang

entry.title: [blinkpy] Do not leak temporary directories in real FS tests
entry.content:
Real FS tests clean up by calling `FileSystem.remove_contents(...)` on

the temporary test directory, but this only empties the target directory

of children. It does not remove the target itself, which `rmtree(...)`

does.

entry.title: FLEDGE: Hold ref to DebugCommandQueue from IOSession.
entry.content:
IOSession held a raw pointer to DebugCommandQueue, which could end up dangling --- DebugCommandQueue is mostly-owned by AuctionV8Helper, while IOSession is normally controlled by its pipe, so it's really hard to say when it will actually get deleted, given lack of ordering guarantees on mojo pipes. Luckily DebugCommandQuue is already ref-counted and doesn't hold much itself (just a thread runner ref), so we can have IOSession co-own it.



(Thanks to miracle ptr for pointing out the problem).





Change-Id: I0399b86795e4af7e6b5092d125c1e678d7f5e51c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4883771

entry.title: [Tailored Security] Prevent running retry in the unset state case
entry.content:
Add a guard for the kTailoredSecuritySyncFlowRetryState is UNSET case.

This case is intended to help in the casees where an older version of

Chrome ran for the user, and it failed. We know that if

kEnhancedProtectionEnabledViaTailoredSecurity is set, then the user has

been shown the Tailored Security dialogs in the past.



By adding an additional condition that

kEnhancedProtectionEnabledViaTailoredSecurity hasn't been set, we can

further target only retrying for users where a very old version of

Chrome may have run the logic (pre-M106) or a post-M106 Chrome ran, and

never succeeded at showing the dialog to the user.



Change-Id: I52f55cba4d6c9bbba4b833b1a5f74e5c9abafada

entry.title: infra: Enforce that any gardened CI bot has a matching trybot
entry.content:
This will prevent anyone from adding a CI bot to a sheriff rotation

when it lacks a matching trybot. A lot of the feedback we've

received from devs is that it can be frustrating to have a sheriff

revert a CL due to it causing failures on a CI bot, while that CI bot

lacks a matching trybot.



So this adds a check to ensure no new builders are added to a gardener

rotation without a trybot.



At this time, however, an exclusion list needs to be used since it's

still an ongoing struggle to fill up all the gaps that already exist.

entry.title: Wire up Capture process frame drops to MediaStreamVideoTrack.
entry.content:
This CL wires up the frame drop callback from the source (which is

aware of Capture process frame drops) to the VideoTrackAdapter, and

makes the VideoAdapter invoke DoNotifyFrameDropped() which is already

wired up to MediaStreamVideoTrack.



This means that the MediaStreamVideoTrack is now aware of all frame

drops, not just the frame drops happening inside VideoTrackAdapter. The

track treats all frame drops the same and does not care if it happened

early or late in the pipeline. This means it is included in the

MediaStreamTrack Statistics API.



This is unit test-covered using a fake source to signal frame drops.



As for end-to-end testing, I have also manually verified that calling

VideoFrameReceiver::OnFrameDropped() inside the Capture process

results in `track.stats.totalFrames` incrementing in JavaScript. This

is unfortunately not testable in Web Platform Tests because fake

sources are not available to JS, and under normal circumstances frames

are flowing without drops.



Bug: chromium:1472978

entry.title: Add frame dropped callback to StartCapture().
entry.content:
As of [1], if getUserMedia() tracks drop frames in the Capture process,

this is signalled to VideoCaptureImpl. In this CL, we plumb the frame

drop signal all the way to MediaStreamVideoSource by adding a

`frame_dropped_callback` parameter to StartCapture().



The relevant stack is updated to wire it down, while other types of

sources that don't have frame dropping can ignore the callback.



This is just an intermediate plumbing CL. The final wiring to the

MediaStreamTrackImpl happens in the next CL.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4878697
